Tucson is slightly taken aback by the empowerment, as he stumbles slightly =
shaking his head with his optics closed for just a moment.  He blinks, and =
slowly opens his eyes.  Instead of darkness he could see blurry shapes form=
ing.  They seem to focus.  He looks down to Lord Elder and can finally see =
him and his comrades for the very first time since his unfortunate accident=
 that left him blind in the beginning.  His silver armor shimmering more th=
an usual, and his mass doubled in size, and physical strength.  He smiles t=
o Lord Elder, now realizing what has just happened.

" It's good to actuall=
y see my comrades instead of just listening to them.  Lord Elder, I wish to=
 thank you for your support in getting me this far. If it had not been for =
you, I would not have made it back to the Ark to fullfill this quest.  And =
of course Rat Trap, he rescued me and if he had not, it wouldn't have been =
possible.  I promise you your debts will be receprocated tenfold."

He look=
s to Kup, and Elita seeing their faces for the first time in years.  He was=
 most joyed to see them again, more than anything else.  His vision clears =
more and more and soon the images of his comrades becomes clear.  He salute=
s them both.

"Kup, Elita, as Autobots I honor you for the courage you've s=
hown me this day.  I will need your courage now my friends.  As we all know=
, Hydras, Cyclonus and Scourge are on a power trip bent on Greed and tyrani=
cal dictatorship.  They wish to gorge themselves on power, rather than reso=
lve the matter of Unicron.  They wish to also over power him, and gain the =
power for themselves.  If they do that, we have more than just a simple dis=
aster on our hands.  That has to be stopped.  Also, we need to get back Rod=
imus, Nightlight and Windlord as soon as possible.  Their sparks are being =
used injustly and I will not tolerate it any further.  Also, when we do man=
age to rescue Rodimus and the others, I had once thought I'd be resentful t=
oward him for allowing himself to fall to such means.. I was wrong to be as=
 such.  And I'd rather not see any of us make the same mistake.  Please, we=
 must be understanding to Rodimus, for none of this was his fault."

He loo=
ks to the computer for any signs from Night Shift. Then he looks back to th=
e room filled with disabled Autobots and Decepticons. 

" Optimus Prime gav=
e me his power for a reason, not only to defeat the evil that infects this =
land, but to also show compassion to those who were cast asside.  These Dec=
epticons who lie dorment with the Autobots, I know we're enemies, but their=
 leader did not lead them with encouragement, he lead them with corruption.=
  And if they failed, he'd treat them like junk.  They did what they had to=
 do because they were forced, not because they wanted to.  We also fight fo=
r their freedom as well as our own.  If only they could awaken, and if only=
 I could tell them that they have the choice to freely chose which faction =
they wish to return to."

He turns back to his comrades.

"Night Shift shou=
ld be almost at the Dark Fortress, hopefully he will send us the informatio=
n we need to reverse the shell program which infects Rodimus and possibly N=
ightlight and Windlord.  It may take him some time to get it to us, but be =
prepared, it could happen sooner than later."

He then transmits to Legacy.=


" Legacy, if you get this transmission, this is Tucson Prime, transmittin=
g to you from the Ark.  Inform the Maximals of my status, and tell them hop=
e will come soon enough.  Tucson Prime, out." 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.c=
om, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > He gets up onto his fe=
et.
> >
> > " My roots have traced me back to Optimus Prime, who was not on=
ly a much admired leader, but also a beloved relative. And as a relative of=
 Optimus Prime, I too, am ready to embrace the vows he once took upon recie=
ving the Matrix of Leadership. I'm ready Matrix, I'M READY TO LIGHT OUR DAR=
KEST HOUR!"
> 
> Even as Tuscon finished speaking the door from the interio=
r of the Ark
> opened as Lord Elder came through.
> 
> At the same time a v=
oice could clearly be heard speaking to Tuscon,
> "Boldness may be needed."=

> 
> Another voice spoke, "A darkness is coming, when the light of all of
=
> us maybe needed."
> 
> As the voices spoke, there was a click, then a rum=
ble as Optimus
> Prime's chest plate split down the middle and then slowly =
opened. From
> inside a light blazed out, and the sphere that was the matri=
x rose up
> in a sea of blue white light that spread out and filled the ent=
ire
> chamber, lighting the room like a miniature star.
> 
> "Arise, Tuscon=
!" came another voice, this one sounding much like Optimus Prime.
> 
> The =
matrix positioned itself above the fallen leader of the Autobots
> as if ob=
serving the room for a moment. Then it oriented on Tuscon.
> 
> "We cannot =
give you the matrix itself, but the power that we have we
> bequeath to you=
."
> 
> From the center of the Matrix a beam of pure energy lanced out and
=
> struck Tuscon, bathing him in a nimbus of coruscating light and power,
> =
changing him, enhancing him, filling him with the energy and wisdom
> that =
was the Autobots.
> 
> "We have given you the embers Tuscon, and its power =
has changed you.
> However to light our darkest hour you must ignite the fl=
ames of that
> which have gone out."
> 
> With those words the ball dimmed =
as it slowly dropped into Optimus
> Prime's chest. With a click the matrix =
settled back into place as
> Optimus' chest cavity and slowly the plates sl=
id shut, and the room
> returned to its dark hue.
> 
> 
> OOC: Tuscon Prime=
 has arrived!!!!!!
> 
> Preston
